MONL.content: when hospitality auto-limits itself into a law [fire’s reflection]
MONL.linkedContent: when hospitality auto-limits itself into a law [fire’s reflection]

MONL.content: Derrida on his relation to French language; the secret, a tattoo, blood mixed w/ ink, love by setting on fire, graft at the fire, mark, let come to itself in itself
MONL.linkedContent: Derrida on his relation to French language; the secret, a tattoo, blood mixed w/ ink, love by setting on fire, graft at the fire, mark, let come to itself in itself

MONL.content: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself
MONL.linkedContent: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself

GOD.content: Dome of Rock, House of Lord in Jerusalem, place of dispute btwn monotheistic faiths of transcendent God, absolute other; they fight over it w/ fire & blood (now, more than ever)
GOD.linkedContent: Dome of Rock, House of Lord in Jerusalem, place of dispute btwn monotheistic faiths of transcendent God, absolute other; they fight over it w/ fire & blood (now, more than ever)

GT.content: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father
GT.linkedContent: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father

R.content: self finds itself infected as soon as soon as it (ipse) needs event, heteronomy
R.linkedContent: self finds itself infected as soon as soon as it (ipse) needs event, heteronomy

H.content: p. anne 136 deconstruction leads to uncanny at heart of the most familiar, where “all we had seen was fire”
H.linkedContent: p. anne 136 deconstruction leads to uncanny at heart of the most familiar, where “all we had seen was fire”

POR.content: for Aristotle, theoretical thinker is above manual laborer, who acts w/out knowing, like fire burns
POR.linkedContent: for Aristotle, theoretical thinker is above manual laborer, who acts w/out knowing, like fire burns

MPM.content: when we know our friend to be gone forever: terrifying lucidity, in light of incinerating blaze where nothingness appears
MPM.linkedContent: when we know our friend to be gone forever: terrifying lucidity, in light of incinerating blaze where nothingness appears

MPM.content: we remain in disbelief itself, we will never believe in death or immortality
MPM.linkedContent: we remain in disbelief itself, we will never believe in death or immortality

EM.content: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics
EM.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics

VP.content: phenomenology (MOP in form of ideality) is also a philosophy of life, death is an empirical and extrinsic accident, everything is light, living light, blazes open passage to reduction
VP.linkedContent: phenomenology (MOP in form of ideality) is also a philosophy of life, death is an empirical and extrinsic accident, everything is light, living light, blazes open passage to reduction

S.content: “I shall speak of ghost, of flame, and of ashes (je parlerai du revenant, de la flamme et des cendres)”
S.linkedContent: “I shall speak of ghost, of flame, and of ashes (je parlerai du revenant, de la flamme et des cendres)”

S.content: from spirit—to fire; history of title De l’esprit ——Rousseau was penning a condemnation of Helvétius’ De l’esprit when he discovered the author was being prosecuted, he threw his text into the fire
S.linkedContent: from spirit—to fire; history of title De l’esprit ——Rousseau was penning a condemnation of Helvétius’ De l’esprit when he discovered the author was being prosecuted, he threw his text into the fire

S.content: spirit’s affirmation, no quotations, spirit inflamed (and yes, I say this, because of the specters flame illuminates of terrifying moment) > Geist is flame, not pneuma or spiritus
S.linkedContent: spirit’s affirmation, no quotations, spirit inflamed (and yes, I say this, because of the specters flame illuminates of terrifying moment) > Geist is flame, not pneuma or spiritus

S.content: for Heidegger, Geist not pneuma, not spiritus, but flame, and he says this can only be thought in German
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Geist not pneuma, not spiritus, but flame, and he says this can only be thought in German

S.content: via Heidegger’s course on Schelling, spirit is only proper if it is close to itself, desire for gathering, a nostalgia, a Sehnsucht, where Sucht, etymologically, isn’t research but evil, evil inscribed in desire > evil as the desire to go out of oneself in order to return to oneself (motif, movement, trajectory of fire, not circle, of return)
S.linkedContent: via Heidegger’s course on Schelling, spirit is only proper if it is close to itself, desire for gathering, a nostalgia, a Sehnsucht, where Sucht, etymologically, isn’t research but evil, evil inscribed in desire > evil as the desire to go out of oneself in order to return to oneself (motif, movement, trajectory of fire, not circle, of return)

S.content: Heidegger: “in spirit there reigns the nostalgia for its own essence”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: “in spirit there reigns the nostalgia for its own essence”

S.content: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]
S.linkedContent: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]

S.content: spirit divides and gathers in conflagration, inflames and inflames itself [absolute spontaneity]
S.linkedContent: spirit divides and gathers in conflagration, inflames and inflames itself [absolute spontaneity]

S.content: furnace of spirit (embrasement de l’esprit), spirit in-flames (l’esprit en-flamme) (verb and noun)
S.linkedContent: furnace of spirit (embrasement de l’esprit), spirit in-flames (l’esprit en-flamme) (verb and noun)

S.content: when Heidegger says spirit is fire he claims it is neither a metaphor nor a figure
S.linkedContent: when Heidegger says spirit is fire he claims it is neither a metaphor nor a figure

S.content: acc. Heidegger, spirit in-flames has evil in it already, thus an evil that is not Platonico-Christian, not of the body, evil is spiritual
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, spirit in-flames has evil in it already, thus an evil that is not Platonico-Christian, not of the body, evil is spiritual

S.content: duplicity of Geist, as its evil ghost, brings forth question: is ash good or evil? whiteness of ash which belongs to destiny consumed and consuming (conflagration of flame)
S.linkedContent: duplicity of Geist, as its evil ghost, brings forth question: is ash good or evil? whiteness of ash which belongs to destiny consumed and consuming (conflagration of flame)

S.content: Heidegger: spirit flames devour, consume, everything, including the white of ash
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: spirit flames devour, consume, everything, including the white of ash

S.content: Trakl: “flame is the brother of the palest”
S.linkedContent: Trakl: “flame is the brother of the palest”

S.content: [references to Hegel’s fire and spirit in Glas]
S.linkedContent: [references to Hegel’s fire and spirit in Glas]

S.content: Jewish thought as inexhaustible thinking of fire
S.linkedContent: Jewish thought as inexhaustible thinking of fire

S.content: Luther: fire, tongues, sacred breath
S.linkedContent: Luther: fire, tongues, sacred breath

S.content: fire-writing, flame writes, writes itself, right in the flame (à même la flamme) > a Riss, frayage of this trait, a mark that leads spirit on the way to soul, pursues soul in way opened by its fire, trait de conflagration, l’esprit en-flamme—trace la route, il fraye la voie
S.linkedContent: fire-writing, flame writes, writes itself, right in the flame (à même la flamme) > a Riss, frayage of this trait, a mark that leads spirit on the way to soul, pursues soul in way opened by its fire, trait de conflagration, l’esprit en-flamme—trace la route, il fraye la voie

S.content: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to flame it divides
S.linkedContent: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to flame it divides

S.content: wouldn’t Jews, Moslem, Christians respond to Heidegger’s retrait, flame and fire-writing in promise? [messianic echoes]
S.linkedContent: wouldn’t Jews, Moslem, Christians respond to Heidegger’s retrait, flame and fire-writing in promise? [messianic echoes]

SH.content: unreadable is readable as unreadable, shibboleth transmitted to a few during finite time of incineration, heart to heart, mouth to ear, hand to hand, still universal by right (legible, coded, troped) > madness of fire: consumes a date from w/in > renders ash from 1st moment
SH.linkedContent: unreadable is readable as unreadable, shibboleth transmitted to a few during finite time of incineration, heart to heart, mouth to ear, hand to hand, still universal by right (legible, coded, troped) > madness of fire: consumes a date from w/in > renders ash from 1st moment

SH.content: incineration takes place before any operations, burns from w/in (not present)
SH.linkedContent: incineration takes place before any operations, burns from w/in (not present)

SH.content: date consumed from w/in, the expiring that is its production, genesis, inscription: its essence & chance
SH.linkedContent: date consumed from w/in, the expiring that is its production, genesis, inscription: its essence & chance

SH.content: there is a holocaust (all-consuming) for every date: “every hour counts its holocaust”
SH.linkedContent: there is a holocaust (all-consuming) for every date: “every hour counts its holocaust”

F.content: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive
F.linkedContent: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive

F.content: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire
F.linkedContent: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire

F.content: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)
F.linkedContent: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)

WM.content: for Bachelard, the hidden (fire) is what demands metaphors, Derrida explains how this conceptualization, despite fact that Bachelard appeals to syntax, “a poetic mind is a syntax of metaphors,” still amounts to metaphor of the same > here, all metaphors have a semantic focal point, the hidden fire as life, nature
WM.linkedContent: for Bachelard, the hidden (fire) is what demands metaphors, Derrida explains how this conceptualization, despite fact that Bachelard appeals to syntax, “a poetic mind is a syntax of metaphors,” still amounts to metaphor of the same > here, all metaphors have a semantic focal point, the hidden fire as life, nature

WM.content: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]
WM.linkedContent: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]

DS.content: hymen will have always disseminated: SPERM, burning lava, milk, spume, dribble of seminal liquor
DS.linkedContent: hymen will have always disseminated: SPERM, burning lava, milk, spume, dribble of seminal liquor

DS.content: difference  is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule
DS.linkedContent: difference is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule

OTO.content: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]
OTO.linkedContent: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

OTO.content: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]

ATIA.content: Valéry’s snake utters the first word (of Verb): “ME,” this “I am that I am,” first impurity, contamination of being, ontological creation, autobiographogenesis, becomes words of seducer > promise to breach purity of nothingness w/ performative
ATIA.linkedContent: Valéry’s snake utters the first word (of Verb): “ME,” this “I am that I am,” first impurity, contamination of being, ontological creation, autobiographogenesis, becomes words of seducer > promise to breach purity of nothingness w/ performative

ATIA.content: I am HE,” auto-zoo-theo-morphic > snake as God, divinity diminished by fires of Seducer
ATIA.linkedContent: I am HE,” auto-zoo-theo-morphic > snake as God, divinity diminished by fires of Seducer

FS.content: Dionysus is worked over by difference, always appears (to himself) by a relationship to his exterior, his death [fire]
FS.linkedContent: Dionysus is worked over by difference, always appears (to himself) by a relationship to his exterior, his death [fire]

O.content: adventurous excess of writing not improv., throw of dice doesn’t contradict rigorous necessity of its “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus) [literature or book: atheistic face of this play, conflagration achieved, final clause located sur la tranche du livre fermé]
O.linkedContent: adventurous excess of writing not improv., throw of dice doesn’t contradict rigorous necessity of its “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus) [literature or book: atheistic face of this play, conflagration achieved, final clause located sur la tranche du livre fermé]

DPi.content: stage lighting of DP, light of fire, never is sovereign more visible than when it makes itself voyante et voyeuse of execution > sovereign witnesses crime, witnesses itself, eye witness
DPi.linkedContent: stage lighting of DP, light of fire, never is sovereign more visible than when it makes itself voyante et voyeuse of execution > sovereign witnesses crime, witnesses itself, eye witness

DPi.content: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body
DPi.linkedContent: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body

RGE.content: via Bataille, affirmation of play outside meaning: potlach of signs that burns, consumes, wastes words in gay affirmation of death: a sacrifice & a challenge (un défi)
RGE.linkedContent: via Bataille, affirmation of play outside meaning: potlach of signs that burns, consumes, wastes words in gay affirmation of death: a sacrifice & a challenge (un défi)

Gii.content: Artaud: hand speaks like a language of fire
Gii.linkedContent: Artaud: hand speaks like a language of fire

Gii.content: Heidegger’s Geist (gheis): lifted, transported out of oneself, like a flame
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Geist (gheis): lifted, transported out of oneself, like a flame

IW.content: Rosenzweig associates abyss w/ volcanic fire (eruption), convulsive tremor marking rhythm of flow of lava—tempo of discontinuous rhetoric
IW.linkedContent: Rosenzweig associates abyss w/ volcanic fire (eruption), convulsive tremor marking rhythm of flow of lava—tempo of discontinuous rhetoric

D.content: fire (black, white), transference from one text to another > consumption (relation btwn death & a certain sun) is textual like dissemination
D.linkedContent: fire (black, white), transference from one text to another > consumption (relation btwn death & a certain sun) is textual like dissemination

D.content: like the crime, consumption/consummation of fire never takes place—this is what the hymen names: 1) penetration, act perpetrated by what enters, consumes, sows confusion btwn partners 2) virginal screen that stands btwn desire/consummation, perpenetration/remembrance
D.linkedContent: like the crime, consumption/consummation of fire never takes place—this is what the hymen names: 1) penetration, act perpetrated by what enters, consumes, sows confusion btwn partners 2) virginal screen that stands btwn desire/consummation, perpenetration/remembrance

D.content: transformations of meaning hinge on certain squaring of text, obligatory passage through open surface, detour through empty square, around the column of fire
D.linkedContent: transformations of meaning hinge on certain squaring of text, obligatory passage through open surface, detour through empty square, around the column of fire

EL.content: jealous, revengeful God of fire (Spinoza’s fright before jealousy of this God) [p. 203 Spinoza’s own fright repeats one he attributes to Hebrews who flee fire in divine word & who thus construct political plan Theological-Political Treatise describes]
EL.linkedContent: jealous, revengeful God of fire (Spinoza’s fright before jealousy of this God) [p. 203 Spinoza’s own fright repeats one he attributes to Hebrews who flee fire in divine word & who thus construct political plan Theological-Political Treatise describes]

EL.content: God speaks out—very fire of vindictive jealousy
EL.linkedContent: God speaks out—very fire of vindictive jealousy

C.content: feu (sur) le paradigme [TN. fire on the paradigm, late paradigm], fuit, il-fût > suicide paradigm, retrac(t)ing by blowing itself up
C.linkedContent: feu (sur) le paradigme [TN. fire on the paradigm, late paradigm], fuit, il-fût > suicide paradigm, retrac(t)ing by blowing itself up

TN.content: tôt (soon): d’avance dévoré par cet autre du temps, consumed, burned, tostus refers to instant, au temps sans temps d’une flamme > on the verge, it’s the end: no time for motion, trop tard
TN.linkedContent: tôt (soon): d’avance dévoré par cet autre du temps, consumed, burned, tostus refers to instant, au temps sans temps d’une flamme > on the verge, it’s the end: no time for motion, trop tard

TN.content: following Nancy’s interpretation of The Death of the Virgin, [Life comme une Morte] a “tôt” announcing an apocalypse (an end not a future) > night of nonknowledge, every desire gathers momentum, Psyche ex-posed to other, surrendered but all too soon denied to the other’s eyes
TN.linkedContent: following Nancy’s interpretation of The Death of the Virgin, [Life comme une Morte] a “tôt” announcing an apocalypse (an end not a future) > night of nonknowledge, every desire gathers momentum, Psyche ex-posed to other, surrendered but all too soon denied to the other’s eyes

TN.content: divine spirit as flame, sets itself on fire, figure of love & desire which spiritualizes hapto-onto-theo-teleology of Christian flesh > highest possibility
TN.linkedContent: divine spirit as flame, sets itself on fire, figure of love & desire which spiritualizes hapto-onto-theo-teleology of Christian flesh > highest possibility

TN.content: start from fire to think the touching of self-touching > not only fire but flames, since light means what is more than a figure: haptical light of self-consuming flames eludes worship, burns effigies spontaneously, “more than a figure,” the transfiguration of figurality
TN.linkedContent: start from fire to think the touching of self-touching > not only fire but flames, since light means what is more than a figure: haptical light of self-consuming flames eludes worship, burns effigies spontaneously, “more than a figure,” the transfiguration of figurality

E.content: God has given himself to be seen in a spectacle, as if he masked/showed himself: an immense liberality which can only give itself to itself to be consumed [how can man’s freedom mimic God’s: by not resembling it?]
E.linkedContent: God has given himself to be seen in a spectacle, as if he masked/showed himself: an immense liberality which can only give itself to itself to be consumed [how can man’s freedom mimic God’s: by not resembling it?]

CIN.content: no cinder w/out fire, that is what is owed (se doit) to fire, [yet, if possible] w/out shadow of sacrifice, at noon, w/out debt, w/out Phoenix, au lieu d’aucun placement, place solely of incineration
CIN.linkedContent: no cinder w/out fire, that is what is owed (se doit) to fire, [yet, if possible] w/out shadow of sacrifice, at noon, w/out debt, w/out Phoenix, au lieu d’aucun placement, place solely of incineration

CIN.content: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur
CIN.linkedContent: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur

CIN.content: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one
CIN.linkedContent: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one

CIN.content: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being
CIN.linkedContent: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being

CIN.content: pure burning light: no sign of passage, pure consuming destruction, noon w/out contrary (Lichtgüsse)
CIN.linkedContent: pure burning light: no sign of passage, pure consuming destruction, noon w/out contrary (Lichtgüsse)

CIN.content: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine
CIN.linkedContent: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine

CIN.content: pure difference of absolute accident, play and pure difference, secret of imperceptible all-burning, does not even relate to its own conflagration, is nothing
CIN.linkedContent: pure difference of absolute accident, play and pure difference, secret of imperceptible all-burning, does not even relate to its own conflagration, is nothing

CIN.content: [question of the bridge asked 3x] 1) how from this consuming destruction w/out limit can something remain that primes dialectical process and opens history? 2) how could the purest of the pure, the worst of the worst, l’incendie panique du brûle-tout, put forth some monument, i.e. pyramis 3) if all-burning destroys its letter, its body, how can it guard the trace of itself and breach/broach (entamer) a history where it preserves (se conserve) itself in losing itself?
CIN.linkedContent: [question of the bridge asked 3x] 1) how from this consuming destruction w/out limit can something remain that primes dialectical process and opens history? 2) how could the purest of the pure, the worst of the worst, l’incendie panique du brûle-tout, put forth some monument, i.e. pyramis 3) if all-burning destroys its letter, its body, how can it guard the trace of itself and breach/broach (entamer) a history where it preserves (se conserve) itself in losing itself?

CIN.content: (ici s’éprouve la force implacable du sens, of mediation, of the negative) all-burning must pass into its contrary, guard itself: as soon as fire shows itself: il reste, il se retient, it loses itself as fire
CIN.linkedContent: (ici s’éprouve la force implacable du sens, of mediation, of the negative) all-burning must pass into its contrary, guard itself: as soon as fire shows itself: il reste, il se retient, it loses itself as fire

CIN.content: the origin of history: pure difference ceases to be what it is to remain what it is, the going down (déclin), setting sun, passage to occidental history
CIN.linkedContent: the origin of history: pure difference ceases to be what it is to remain what it is, the going down (déclin), setting sun, passage to occidental history

CIN.content: chance of substance as a sacrifice [?], the all-burning sacrifices itself as all-burning, erection of the pyramid guards life (the dead)—“Opfer,” even but better “holocaust,” burns all (caustos holos), even burns fire, holocaust contains seeds of ontology [re: Hegel]
CIN.linkedContent: chance of substance as a sacrifice [?], the all-burning sacrifices itself as all-burning, erection of the pyramid guards life (the dead)—“Opfer,” even but better “holocaust,” burns all (caustos holos), even burns fire, holocaust contains seeds of ontology [re: Hegel]

CIN.content: this holocaust as the gift, before (if one could count time) ontology, w/out which the dialectical movement & history of Being couldn’t open, no engaging annulus of anniversary, no annulment in solar course from Orient to Occident
CIN.linkedContent: this holocaust as the gift, before (if one could count time) ontology, w/out which the dialectical movement & history of Being couldn’t open, no engaging annulus of anniversary, no annulment in solar course from Orient to Occident

CIN.content: gift & holocaust, before exchange, are not, but as soon as it burns, it burns its very act of burning and begins to be > the speculative, dialectic: the reflection (speculum) of holocaust’s holocaust, the blaze cooled by glass, ice mirror
CIN.linkedContent: gift & holocaust, before exchange, are not, but as soon as it burns, it burns its very act of burning and begins to be > the speculative, dialectic: the reflection (speculum) of holocaust’s holocaust, the blaze cooled by glass, ice mirror

CIN.content: the gift can only be a sacrifice: that is the axiom of speculative reason > it must become philosophy, religion’s truth
CIN.linkedContent: the gift can only be a sacrifice: that is the axiom of speculative reason > it must become philosophy, religion’s truth

CIN.content: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?
CIN.linkedContent: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?

CIN.content: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning
CIN.linkedContent: rebellion against Phoenix, affirmation of fire w/out place or mourning

CIN.content: nothing out of reach of the tongue of fire (langue de feu), not even cinders if there are cinders there, save a chance (fors une chance)
CIN.linkedContent: nothing out of reach of the tongue of fire (langue de feu), not even cinders if there are cinders there, save a chance (fors une chance)

CIN.content: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat
CIN.linkedContent: essence of cinder (its cinder itself): the insistent pharmakon of a plural body (doesn’t belong to itself) in which the retreat of fire disguises itself > if there is cinder, fire remains in retreat

CIN.content: “give fire its due, light counterfires in order to stop the progression of a blaze, avoid a holocaust” > fire’s share (part) is impossible to delimit (by virtue of the lexicon, the ‘themes’)
CIN.linkedContent: “give fire its due, light counterfires in order to stop the progression of a blaze, avoid a holocaust” > fire’s share (part) is impossible to delimit (by virtue of the lexicon, the ‘themes’)

OG.content: slow place of pedagogy, Nature takes her time, outpaced by immediacy of dangerous supplement which burns the halting points (brûle les étapes), consumes l’énergie sans retour
OG.linkedContent: slow place of pedagogy, Nature takes her time, outpaced by immediacy of dangerous supplement which burns the halting points (brûle les étapes), consumes l’énergie sans retour

EU.content: in 1644, Courcelle’s Latin translation of Discourse of Method doesn’t include Descartes’ “I am speaking French” > when “original” speaks its language by speaking of its language, it prepares a suicide by translation, suicide by fire: almost w/out remainder [tells us about idiomaticity in general]
EU.linkedContent: in 1644, Courcelle’s Latin translation of Discourse of Method doesn’t include Descartes’ “I am speaking French” > when “original” speaks its language by speaking of its language, it prepares a suicide by translation, suicide by fire: almost w/out remainder [tells us about idiomaticity in general]

EU.content: this translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin
EU.linkedContent: this translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin

SPEC.content: [fire-like] unleashed intensity of PP would destroy itself if it didn’t submit to moderating stricture, if it didn’t measure itself
SPEC.linkedContent: [fire-like] unleashed intensity of PP would destroy itself if it didn’t submit to moderating stricture, if it didn’t measure itself

SPEC.content: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
SPEC.linkedContent: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
